title: Senate CJS Appropriators See Artemis as Top NASA Priority
summary: The Senate appropriators who fund NASA left no doubt today that the Artemis program is their top priority for the agency. In a friendly hearing, Democrats and Republicans stressed the […]

title: NASA defends Artemis cost and schedule amid planning of possible changes
summary: NASA Administrator Bill Nelson defended the cost and schedule performance of the agency’s Artemis lunar exploration effort even as officials hinted as the possibility for changes in one upcoming mission.

title: Initial Gateway elements beginning systems integration while NASA works on a launch date
summary: The two elements that will make up the initial Gateway capability for NASA’s Artemis campaign are getting ready for systems installations this year and next year, as the space agency reviews progress to set a new launch date. The Power and Propulsion Element (PPE) and Habitation and Logistics Module (HALO) are being constructed on different continents for eventual launch together as the Gateway’s co-manifested vehicle (CMV).

title: Investing in Space: How the Pentagon is making use of AI with spy satellite data
summary: Last week I had the opportunity to take part in venture firm Space Capital’s NYC summit, which gathered investors and portfolio companies and included a number of panels on key industry topics such as Starship and China.

title: U.S. seeks bids from satellite manufacturers for military Space Test Program
summary: The Space Test Program office issued its final request for proposals for the Space Test Experiments Platform (STEP) 2.0 contract

title: Intelsat extends satellite life extension contracts
summary: Intelsat has signed a deal to use the MEV-2 servicer currently docked with its 10-02 satellite to extend the aging spacecraft’s life by four more years to 2030.

title: From Orbit to Ground: What’s next?
summary: Interstate 95 is America’s busiest highway. Spanning over 1,900 miles between Miami in the south and the Canadian border with Maine in the north, it hosts more than 72,000 vehicles […]

title: Stanford center focuses on spacecraft autonomy
summary: The Center for AEroSpace Autonomy Research (CAESAR) at Stanford University held a kickoff event May 22 to highlight the industry, academia and government collaboration it seeks to foster.

title: Airbus to build ESA space science satellite
summary: The European Space Agency has awarded Airbus Defence and Space a contract to build a spacecraft that will provide a unique view of the sun.

title: House Armed Services Committee advances 2025 defense policy bill
summary: An amendment by Rep. Joe Wilson would require the Space Force to secure state governors’ approval before absorbing any Air National Guard space units into the service
